alert.note: Alert for McLeod; Meeker (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 14 at 12:01AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...DANGEROUSLY COLD WIND CHILLS INTO NEXT WEEK... .With snow ending, attention turns to the dangerously cold wind chills tonight, with widespread values of 25 to 40 degrees below zero likely through early next week. A Wind Chill Warning is in effect for western and southern Minnesota tonight through Sunday morning. A Wind Chill Advisory is in effect for eastern Minnesota and western Wisconsin tonight through Sunday morning. After Sunday morning, Wind Chill Advisories continue across central and southern Minnesota through Tuesday morning as wind chill values will remain between 20 and 35 degrees below zero most of the day on Sunday and Monday. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Meeker and McLeod Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
